About Neuro Experts, PC

Precision in Neuroradiology, Trust in Expert Care.

We are a premier firm for neuroradiology services and unbiased medical-legal consulting led by award-winning CEO Dr. Saman Hazany, MD, DABR. We focus on a wide range of medical imaging techniques for neurodegenerative disorders.

With unwavering dedication to patient-centered care, our team provides exceptional clinical insight for clinical trials and medico-legal cases.

Complimentary initial consultation available for new cases and second opinions.

Leadership

Saman Hazany, MD, DABR

Specialty: Radiology and Neuroradiology

Expertise: Traumatic Brain and Spine Injury Imaging, CT, MRI, DTI

Harvard-trained neuroradiologist with extensive experience in concussion and traumatic brain injury imaging. Academic appointments at UCLA and USC with leadership experience in neuroradiology education and research.

View full leadership profile or meet the full team.

Medical-legal imaging guidance

Imaging is an essential component of a comprehensive approach to neurological disease diagnosis, especially in setting of trauma. In many cases, imaging is the sole objective evidence that supports the true diagnosis and extent of disease. Validity of neuro-imaging and its contribution to the outcome of a litigation depends on type and quality of images and accuracy of interpretation.

  • Complimentary initial consultation. Call or email us for a second opinion if your neuroimaging was not interpreted by a board and CAQ certified neuroradiologist.
  • Comprehensive neuroradiology medical-legal evaluation for attorneys.
  • Call or email us if you believe your client's imaging was misinterpreted. Misinterpretation of imaging findings can mislead and erroneously change the course of a litigation. For example, common findings of traumatic brain injury (TBI) such as subtle "subarachnoid hemorrhage", "brain contusion", and "volume loss and gliosis", are regularly missed or misinterpreted by non-expert neuroradiologists.
  • Advanced MR imaging sequences such as Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) provide insight on location, extent, and severity of TBI. These sequences are frequently interpreted inaccurately by non-expert radiologists. Clinical and research expertise in DTI imaging allows our TBI imaging expert witnesses' accurate interpretation of advanced modalities.
  • Contact us with questions about DTI.

Our mission

At Neuro Experts, PC, our mission is to provide expert neuroradiology care that empowers individuals and professionals with precise and accessible imaging services. We strive to deliver quality images through advanced technology and cutting-edge techniques, improving patient outcomes and supporting medical and legal professionals across California.

We are dedicated to serving medical centers, legal professionals, and, most importantly, patients with unmatched quality and impartial results in interpreting neuroimaging, including Computed Tomography (CT) scans and Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI).

Vision

We envision ourselves as a leader in the world of medical-legal consulting and neuroradiology, integrating new-age medical imaging techniques with an unscathed industry reputation and years of expertise. Our vision encompasses a future where our technology and knowledge contribute to timely, accurate, and impactful outcomes in both legal and healthcare spheres.

Core values

Neuro Experts, PC is nothing without its values, and here are the principles and values we put our faith in.

Precision

Accurate diagnoses rely on clear, detailed, and expertly interpreted brain images and spine imaging.

Compassion

We are committed to patient-centered care and evidence-based practice across clinical and medico-legal work.

Integrity

We promise unbiased and accurate opinions with utmost impartiality, especially in expert witness cases.

Why choose Neuro Experts, PC?

At Neuro Experts, PC, we understand that high-quality, specialized imaging can significantly influence outcomes in both medical and legal settings.

  • Comprehensive interpretation across CT, PET, SPECT, MRI, DTI, fMRI, MR perfusion, MR spectroscopy, and volumetric analysis.
  • California radiologist and neuroradiologist expert witness support for personal injury, accident cases, workplace injury, and medical malpractice.
  • Research consulting to advance imaging for TBI, dementia, epilepsy, and neuro-oncology.
  • Quick turnaround time, typically less than 24-48 hours, plus complimentary initial consultation.
If you have questions or want to schedule a free consultation, call or email us directly.
